title: Ticket #640: condor_config_val -set is broken
description: It seems -set and -rset are broken in terms of condor_config_val. Since it appears to have been that way a very long time and no one has complained until now, maybe this functionality should be removed? I can also see situations where admins forget the used those features and get very confused about why their pool isn't behaving the way they expect as defined in the condor_config file.
remarks:
2009-Jul-27 15:32:04 by matt:
Umm... 

$ condor_version
$CondorVersion: 7.3.2 Jun  8 2009 BuildID: RH-7.3.2-0.2.el5 PRE-RELEASE-UWCS $
$CondorPlatform: X86_64-LINUX_RHEL5 $

$ tail ~condor/condor_config.local
ENABLE_RUNTIME_CONFIG = TRUE
HOSTALLOW_CONFIG = *.lab.bos.redhat.com
SETTABLE_ATTRS_CONFIG = MF_*

$ condor_config_val -master MF_A
Not defined

$ condor_config_val -rset -master "MF_A=100"
Successfully set configuration "MF_A=100" on master mrg29.lab.bos.redhat.com <10.16.44.234:51247>.

$ condor_reconfig -master
Sent "Reconfig" command to local master

$ condor_config_val -master MF_A
100

Was a reconfig not done?

2009-Jul-27 15:34:42 by matt:
BTW, the need for a reconfig is discussed a few places in the manual, including the man page for condor_config_val -- it might not be flashing enough though.

http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.3/condor_config_val.html

2009-Jul-27 16:01:06 by psilord:
Where did you find in the manual you had to set SETTABLE_ATTRS in order to make this work?

2009-Jul-27 16:41:05 by matt:
http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.3/3_6Security.html#SECTION00469000000000000000

2009-Jul-28 10:54:24 by psilord:
Indeed, I tested it like how Matt explained, and it worked.

2009-Jul-28 12:08:22 by smoler:
In the manual, extra links from the condor_config_val man page have been added, noting the config knobs that must be set for -set and -rset to work. This will show in the 7.2.5 release and future 7.3.x releases.

2009-Jul-28 13:36:15 by psilord:
Thanks! Resolving Ticket.
